ygData.msgSnippet: Tarantulas looked over his new blueprint. It was impressive, and a new addition to the team. The attack on the Allience was going to be a long one....that was

    Tarantulas looked over his new blueprint. It was impressive, and a new 
addition to the team. The attack on the Allience was going to be a long 
one....that was for sure. For the moment, though, Tarantulas' latest scheme 
seemed to give the Predacons an upper hand.
    "I like it. With the sub, and a few of these, I dont see why we wont 
break their shileds and march right inside." Hell Beast commented as he gazed 
over the arachnids shoulder. He gave a half smile.
    "Hehe, yes, it should definetly shake things up. How is the submarine 
construction going?" He said, all eight eyes on Hell Beast's now grim and 
solid face.
    He folded his hands, "Oh, its going as planned, that it is."

    Inferno buzzed through the sky in the loader. On board he carried the 
parts of Aracnia ship needed to forge the Sub. What remained left was being 
taken to Kitkats base. 
    "Inferno to Rampage. I am closing in on your coordinates. Im will begin 
landing proceedures now." He said, and pressed in the landing codes.
    The ship slowed and then began to slowly float down to the construction 
platform. The parts inside the loader shook a little, but the stablizers 
leveled the vessle. With a successful landing, Inferno exited.
    "Good job Inferno. Begin construction now. I will start the generator." 
Rampage said, looking down from the coomand platform. As commander of this 
mission, he was in charge of the sub's safety. And a shield generator was 
just the thing to keep unwated pests away and out of Predacon business. With 
the flick of a few switches, a crack like electricity filled the coastline 
and the spiderweb like shiled rose around the platform.
    Rampage then turned to Inferno, "Good. Lets start"

    Tankkor pulled the skelteon of Aracnia's ship behinde him through the 
heat of the savana. In his tank mode he could pull a heavy load, including 
what was left of the ship. With his turret ready for fire, he moved on, as 
fast as he could go.
